GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 14, 2025
Tajuanda Latriece Carey
Spectrum Human Services Independent Living
28303 Joy RD.
Westland, MI. 48185-5524
RE: License#: CB820252473
Dear Ms. Carey:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 3/13/25. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.

Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan in response to the interim
inspection completed 4/10/2024 with a corrective action plan approved on
5/8/2024. The agency was in violation with Rules 12418 (2) (a), 12418 (2) (b) and
Policy 722.06B. The agency does not have any repeat violations with these rules
during this reporting period.
The agency had one special investigation SI#2024SIC001299, that was initiated
on 4/2/2024. The report was completed on 5/30/2024 and CAP approved on
8/7/2024. The agency was in violation with Rule 12207 (3) (a). The agency has
not had any repeat violations of this rule.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
Chief Administrator (CA) reported one of their biggest barriers is receiving youths
into their program and the previous agency not completing the youth report from
that reporting period. This process affects their program because Spectrum case
managers have to complete the report even after accepting the case for a brief
time period. CA reported Spectrum case managers have to make a statement in
the report that Spectrum is only able to report the progress from the date the youth
entered into their Spectrum IL program. She identified another barrier as youth
funding changing to YAVFC and the case not opening in a timely manner. She
reported this causes late reports. She said it occurs often, and the case managers
enter a social work contact in the cases of their many attempts to rectify the
issues. CA said on a positive note, the case managers are encouraged to make
case service plans a priority and the director will monitor cases to assist the case
managers and hope to reach compliance of 100%.
Financial Overview:
The agency Independent Auditors’ Report dated 9/30/23 and 2022, and the annual
financial budget report were reviewed. No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews:
Three staff were interviewed via telephone. All staff reported accolades and
support for their supervisors and the agency administration. All staff reported
getting the training they need to complete their job responsibilities. The staff
would not change anything about the program and reported they love working for
the agency. No concerns were reported.

Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has adequate space and equipment to complete required
responsibilities. CHRI is stored securely (locked) that prevent unauthorized
access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS to provide foster care placement or
certification services, therefore this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
3/13/2025
___________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
